reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports, Panel of Experts reports: midterm report by 3 August 2018 and final report by 1 February 2019
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous relevant resolutions and statements, 
Decides to extend the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in paragraph 29 of resolution 2094 (2013), until 24 April 2019, and applies this mandate to measures imposed in resolutions 2270 (2016), 2321 (2016), 2356 (2017), 2371 (2017), 2375 (2017), and 2397 (2017).

Requests the Panel to provide:
- A midterm report to the Committee by 3 August 2018 and to the Council by 7 September 2018,
- A final report to the Committee by 1 February 2019 and to the Council by 14 March 2019.

Requests the Panel to provide a planned program of work within thirty days of reappointment and to update the Committee on any changes.

Urges States, UN bodies, and other parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and Panel, providing information on implementation of imposed measures.

Expresses intent to follow the Panel's work and review its mandate by 24 March 2019.

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
